graph.original_query: Create a professional one-page (index.html) dark-themed (Black and White only) portfolio website for a Software Hacker using Tailwind CSS, Flowbite, Animate.css (for scroll-in section reveals and CTA hover transitions), and Splide.js (for a testimonial carousel and horizontally scrolling image gallery); use CDN only (no build tools); apply a sleek black/charcoal base, warm beige/muted orange accents, elegant typography, refined spacing, subtle transitions (no glows/neons); include sticky header with anchor links, hero section with fullscreen image (https://picsum.photos/1600/900?blur=1), category highlight cards (https://picsum.photos/400/600?grayscale/random=1), animated counters (clients, projects, years), About (mission, timeline), Gallery or Services grid (6–8 projects), Contact form (name/email/message), and footer with social icons; keep layout responsive and professional, with no lorem ipsum, real readable text, and pure HTML/CSS/JS; Use CoderAgent in 9–10 precise updates (meta, header, hero, counters, cards, timeline, gallery, testimonial slider, contact form, layout cleanup), and finally audit spacing, contrast, and visual balance to ensure premium Software Hacker look. Ask the CoderAgent to update the same index.html, use code to update it if file is longer and make sure old content is not deleted, and only required sections are updated.

T001.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to create the basic HTML structure for the `index.html` file as requested, including meta tags, links to necessary CDNs (Tailwind CSS, Flowbite, Animate.css, Splide.js), and empty sections for the specified page layout elements (sticky header, hero, category cards, counters, about, gallery, contact, footer). The structure should be valid HTML5 and use semantic tags.

T002.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to modify the existing `index.html` file to implement a sticky, dark-themed header with anchor links using Tailwind CSS. I'll add the necessary anchor links to the existing `<nav>` element within the `<header>`. I will not remove any pre-existing HTML. I need to ensure that the header elements are styled appropriately for the dark theme. I should avoid introducing errors, and must update the existing file and not generate new content from scratch.

files.index.html:
Software Hacker
Hero Categories About Gallery Contact

T003.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to modify the `index.html` file to create a hero section with a fullscreen background image, title, and description, using Tailwind CSS and Animate.css. I'll ensure that the text is readable and well-positioned, and that the elements respond to the dark theme. I must update the existing file and not remove pre-existing content.

files.index.html:
Software Hacker
Hero Categories About Gallery Contact

Software Hacker

Crafting innovative solutions and turning ideas into reality.

I need to locate the section with id="counters" and update its contents with the required HTML. Make sure to preserve the dark theme styling. I'll use realistic numbers for the counters.

I will use Tailwind CSS and Animate.css for styling and hover transitions, and fetch images from picsum.photos. I will insert the new section after the counters section, ensuring it integrates well with the existing dark theme and is responsive. No existing code will be deleted.

T006.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to modify the `index.html` file to add the About section, incorporating a mission statement and a timeline. I'll use Tailwind CSS for styling and Animate.css for scroll-in effects. I need to ensure the new section integrates seamlessly with the existing content and respects the dark theme. I will inject this new section before the category highlights section and make sure the changes are responsive and visually appealing.

files.index.html:
About Me

Mission

Empowering the digital frontier by crafting innovative software solutions and pioneering ethical hacking practices. Committed to securing the digital world, one line of code at a time.

Career Timeline

2018

First Steps

Started learning programming with Python and explored basic cybersecurity concepts.

2020

Diving Deeper

Contributed to open-source projects and began specializing in web application security.

2022

Professional Role

Secured a role as a cybersecurity analyst, focusing on threat detection and incident response.

2024

Leading the Charge

Spearheading projects to bolster data security and enhance network resilience. Actively contributing to cybersecurity research and development.

nodes.description: Create the basic HTML structure for the index.html file, including meta tags, link to Tailwind CSS, Flowbite, Animate.css, and Splide.js CDNs, and a basic page layout with sections for header, hero, counters, cards, about, gallery, contact, and footer.
nodes.agent_prompt:
Create a basic HTML structure for the index.html file. Include the following:
- Meta tags for viewport and character set.
- Links to Tailwind CSS, Flowbite, Animate.css, and Splide.js CDNs.
- A basic page layout with empty sections for:
  - Sticky Header with anchor links.
  - Hero section with a fullscreen image.
  - Category highlight cards.
  - Animated counters (clients, projects, years).
  - About section (mission, timeline).
  - Gallery or Services grid (6–8 projects).
  - Contact form (name/email/message).
  - Footer with social icons.
Ensure the structure is valid HTML5 and uses semantic tags where appropriate. Do not include any content, just the basic structure. Name the file as index.html

output.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to create the basic HTML structure for the `index.html` file as requested, including meta tags, links to necessary CDNs (Tailwind CSS, Flowbite, Animate.css, Splide.js), and empty sections for the specified page layout elements (sticky header, hero, category cards, counters, about, gallery, contact, footer). The structure should be valid HTML5 and use semantic tags.

nodes.description: Implement the sticky header with anchor links to different sections of the page. Use Tailwind CSS for styling and Flowbite for any interactive components.
nodes.agent_prompt: Modify the existing index.html file (output from T001) to implement a sticky header. The header should include anchor links to the hero, about, gallery, and contact sections. Use Tailwind CSS for styling to create a sleek, dark-themed header. Use Flowbite components if needed for interactive elements. Ensure the header remains fixed at the top of the page on scroll. Ensure that the header elements respond accordingly to the dark theme. Do not remove anything that was already made.

output.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to modify the existing `index.html` file to implement a sticky, dark-themed header with anchor links using Tailwind CSS. nodes.description: Create the hero section with a fullscreen image from https://picsum.photos/1600/900?blur=1. Add a title and a brief description of the software hacker. Use Tailwind CSS for styling and Animate.css for a scroll-in reveal animation.
nodes.agent_prompt:
Modify the existing index.html file (output from T002) to create the hero section. The hero section should include:
- A fullscreen image from https://picsum.photos/1600/900?blur=1 as the background.
- A title for the software hacker.
- A brief description of the software hacker.
Use Tailwind CSS for styling to create a visually appealing hero section. Use Animate.css for a scroll-in reveal animation when the section comes into view. Ensure the text is readable and well-positioned on top of the background image. Ensure that the hero section elements respond accordingly to the dark theme. Do not remove anything that was already made.

nodes.description: Create the category highlight cards using images from https://picsum.photos/400/600?grayscale/random=1. Add a title and description for each card. Use Tailwind CSS for styling and Animate.css for hover transitions.
nodes.agent_prompt:
Modify the existing index.html file (output from T004) to create the category highlight cards section. The section should include:
- 3-4 category highlight cards.
- Use images from https://picsum.photos/400/600?grayscale/random=1 for each card.
- Add a title and description for each card.
- Use Tailwind CSS for styling to create a visually appealing section.
- Use Animate.css for hover transitions.
Ensure the cards are responsive and visually balanced. Ensure that the category highlight cards section elements respond accordingly to the dark theme. Do not remove anything that was already made.

output.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to modify the `index.html` file to add the category highlight cards section. I will use Tailwind CSS and Animate.css for styling and hover transitions, and fetch images from picsum.photos. I will insert the new section after the counters section, ensuring it integrates well with the existing dark theme and is responsive. No existing code will be deleted.

nodes.agent_prompt:
Modify the existing index.html file (output from T005) to implement the About section. The section should include:
- A mission statement for the software hacker.
- A timeline of the software hacker's career with 3-4 milestones.
- Use Tailwind CSS for styling to create a visually appealing section.
- Use Animate.css for scroll-in section reveals.
Ensure the section is well-structured and the timeline is easy to follow. Ensure that the About section elements respond accordingly to the dark theme. Do not remove anything that was already made.

nodes.description: Create the Gallery or Services grid with 6–8 projects. Use images and descriptions for each project. Use Tailwind CSS for styling.
nodes.agent_prompt:
Modify the existing index.html file (output from T006) to create the Gallery or Services grid. The grid should include:
- 6–8 projects.
- Use images and descriptions for each project.
- Use Tailwind CSS for styling to create a visually appealing grid.
Ensure the grid is responsive and the projects are displayed in a visually appealing manner. Ensure that the Gallery or Services grid elements respond accordingly to the dark theme. Do not remove anything that was already made.

nodes.description: Implement the testimonial slider using Splide.js. Include 3-4 testimonials with images and names. Use Tailwind CSS for styling.
nodes.agent_prompt:
Modify the existing index.html file (output from T007) to implement the testimonial slider using Splide.js. The slider should include:
- 3-4 testimonials with images and names.
- Use Tailwind CSS for styling to create a visually appealing slider.
Ensure the slider is functional and the testimonials are displayed correctly. Ensure that the testimonial slider elements respond accordingly to the dark theme. Do not remove anything that was already made.

nodes.description: Create the Contact form with name, email, and message fields. Use Tailwind CSS for styling and Flowbite for form elements.
nodes.agent_prompt:
Modify the existing index.html file (output from T008) to create the Contact form. The form should include:
- Name, email, and message fields.
- Use Tailwind CSS for styling to create a visually appealing form.
- Use Flowbite for form elements.
Ensure the form is functional and the fields are validated. Ensure that the contact form elements respond accordingly to the dark theme. Do not remove anything that was already made.

nodes.description: Create the footer with social icons. Use Tailwind CSS for styling and Font Awesome for social icons.
nodes.agent_prompt:
Modify the existing index.html file (output from T009) to create the footer. The footer should include:
- Social icons for popular platforms like LinkedIn, GitHub, Twitter, etc.
- Use Tailwind CSS for styling to create a visually appealing footer.
- Use Font Awesome for social icons.
Ensure the footer is displayed at the bottom of the page and the icons are linked correctly. Ensure that the footer elements respond accordingly to the dark theme. Do not remove anything that was already made.

nodes.description: Perform final layout cleanup, audit spacing, contrast, and visual balance to ensure a premium Software Hacker look. Ensure responsiveness across different devices.
nodes.agent_prompt:
Modify the existing index.html file (output from T010) to perform final layout cleanup. This includes:
- Auditing spacing, contrast, and visual balance to ensure a premium Software Hacker look.
- Ensuring responsiveness across different devices.
- Making sure the design adheres to the specified dark theme (Black and White only) with warm beige/muted orange accents.
- Refining typography and subtle transitions.
Do not remove anything that was already made. Focus on making changes so that the end output should be perfect.

nodes.description: Summarize the job that was just completed and the final code output.
nodes.agent_prompt: Summarize the job that was just completed by the CoderAgent in task T011 and the final code output in that last task.
